lexUnit.name: rise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: get up from lying, sitting, or kneeling

sentence.text: He rose from his knees .
She rose from her knees to face two pairs of eyes in which hope had died at last .
She rose from the floor , her face puffed and blotchy , and curled up on the sofa , her knees drawn up to her chin .
Renate chose that moment to rise from the floor .
He rose from his chair , came over to her and took her hand in his .
Then she nodded with decision and rose from her chair .
The Professor rose from his chair and crossed the room to where something rested upon an ornate Victorian easel covered by a green baize cloth .
` That 's right , " agreed Mrs Tilling , rising from her chair and brushing a fine collection of sticky crumbs from her coat .
It 's what will WE do ? " he replied , rising from his chair to kiss her lightly on the forehead on his way to the Scotch decanter .
Edward finished his meal quickly and rose from the table .
She rose from the table , picked up her brolly and handbag and went to the downstairs bedroom she shared with Dad to collect a change of clothes .
When Tamar rose from the table , she remarked , ` I shall go out for a ride , Mama . "
Anya has risen from her seat , takes up a position facing Rainbow , at the opposite end of the mantelpiece .
Guests rose from their seats , men pushing and shoving each other .
Charles rose from his seat and walked out of the dressing room .
In the event , they rose from their seats , booed and shuffled out to the box-office , where they demanded their money back without success .
He rose from his enormous desk and lit a big cigar -- it could n't have been a Havana -- and strutted around his vast office like a peacock , admiring his reflection in the long mirror .
Southworth rose from the desk and walked to the drinks cabinet .
The Exec Director rose from his desk and crossed to the window , stared out on the cold , snow-filled landscape that filtered down to Langley .
Accordingly , without ever rising from my sordid bed , I lay and groaned and babbled , and altogether gave a wonderful impression of a man in extremity .
He rose from his chair and embraced her warmly .
She had risen from the couch and was awaiting his approach , her consternation evident as if she had been caught out in some misbehaviour .
The sergeant major rose from the bench by his locker .
Silently he drained his mug and , rising to his feet , handed it to her .
Jake rose to his feet , smiling , throwing off his anger like a mantle .
Michele rose to his feet , and , tossing his snowy napkin on to the table , followed the housekeeper into the palazzo .
` I 'm glad you brought Fon to see me , " Nina said , as she rose to her feet and clutched Joe 's arm , heading through the back door into the kitchen .
Graham rose to his feet and shook Laidlaw 's extended hand .
Once , moved beyond composure by something he heard or saw , he rose abruptly and stood with his back to them , facing out over the sodden countryside .
Ludens rose slowly .
He rose abruptly , and began to walk the wide chamber with his wine cup dangled lightly between his fingers , a habit of his when he was thoughtful .
Mr Scott rose slowly again .
He rose slowly from the chair .
Natasha rose abruptly and began a slow circuit of the court , with Charlotte beside her .
Slowly he rose from his seat and went over to the headmaster who stood twisting the piece of white chalk between his fingers .
She was pushing against his chest but Fred rose to his feet and , moving sideways , suddenly bent down and swept her up in his strong arms .
As soon as the Queen had completed her formal duties , King Alfons rose to make his reply .
